alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued February 01 at 5:22AM EST until February 01 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (7.6 to 7.8 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Charleston and Coastal Colleton Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties. Motorists should be prepared for delays if traveling in Downtown Charleston as road closures are likely. Water could also flood roads on portions of Isle of Palms and Folly Beach as well as roads adjacent to the Stono River in West Ashley. Water could approach or surround structures along Docksite Road on Edisto Beach. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 8:03 AM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/08 AM 7.7 1.9 1.2 N/A Moderate 01/08 PM 6.3 0.5 1.0 N/A None 02/09 AM 7.3 1.5 1.0 N/A Minor 02/09 PM 6.4 0.6 1.0 N/A None 03/10 AM 7.1 1.3 1.0 N/A Minor 03/10 PM 6.3 0.5 0.9 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
